project_abstract.cdata: The Industrial Credit Project supports the establishment of a new institution, the China Investment Bank (CIB), which will provide investment loans for small- and medium-size light industrial projects needing foreign exchange. The project is part of the ongoing economic reforms in China. The objective will be to help raise investment efficiency through import of technology and the introduction of improved project design and selection methodology. Subborrowers will be state enterprises primarily in Shanghai, Tianjin and Jiangsu. The main project risks relate to the capacity of CIB, which is a new institution, to develop and implement suitable subproject selection, appraisal and supervision procedures and standards, and to the need for continued Government commitment to the process of economic reform. The project provides for training and technical assistance for CIB, and the process of economic reform in expected to continue.

P003413.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>ZH</LangCode><ProjectName>第一工业信贷项目</ProjectName><ProjectAbstract>本项目支持组建新金融机构——中国投资银行，由其向需要外汇的中小型轻工项目提供投资贷款。本项目是中国现行经济改革的组成部分，其目标是协助通过引进技术和引入先进的项目设计和选择方法提高投资效率。项目的地方贷款人为国有企业，它们主要位于上海、天津和江苏三省市。项目的主要风险同以下因素相关：（1）新组建机构中国投资银行制定并实施子合理的子项目选择、评估和监督检查程序和标准的能力；（2）政府在经济改革过程中继续支持中国投资银行的必要性。项目将向中国投资银行提供培训和技术援助。经济改革进程有望继续推进。</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>
